caption: For starters, Pizza Policy’s pizza is just the gateway to their menu. Daily meal specials (think meatloaf, tomato soup, etc.), salad and sandwich varieties, wings (they have Mumbo), desserts and more encourage your return for more. This said, make sure to comb their SPECIALS section(s) before going straight to their mainstays. On my short list for some time, I recruited my brother to truly flesh out... Our order (including a few pics with review):  The Oath *special pizza The Transfer *special pizza The Recess *special pizza Cheesesteak Cuban Grilled Cheese Pizza Grilled Cheese Fried Chicken Sandwich *special Grab-N-Go sandwich Parmesan Truffle Fries Tiramisu *limited special Pop Tart (Strawberry)  Yup, just the two of us and after having enjoyed each of these, there is no need to tease yourself by just ordering a pizza. OK? Ok.  The pizzas, although DRASTICALLY DIFFERENT from one another, shared one thing in common: quality ingredients you could taste. The Oath boasted butternut squash and kale propped up with roasted garlic and caramelized onion. The Transfer shared mild pesto, feta and roasted tomato with the bite of Italian sausage and calming mozzarella. The Recess, despite being a straightforward BBQ chicken pizza, retained a familiar, tangy sauce coupled with hints of red onion. All enjoyable and the last takeaway? Foldable. Do not get discouraged when you read “thin crust.” These aren’t crackers like we have in the area. P. Policy’s pizzas have just enough dough to tread that fine line and I couldn’t be more pleased.  The sandwiches were good. Not bad. Not great. Good. Give a gold medal for that Fried Chicken one though. The cheesesteak (w/beef tenderloin) was clean and lackadaisically flavorful. Not traditional but I ordered a cheesesteak from a place called PIZZA POLICY (a W. Millar & Co. Catering project). YMMV The grilled cheeses (pizza and Cuban) were creatively memorable. The pizza grilled cheese was the standout here even though it was the most basic. The Cuban left quite a bit to be desired despite not skimping on fillings. Both were on thick’ish sourdough. The Fried Chicken Sandwich is a cool/cold sandwich so be mentally prepared when ordering. I was not and my raised eyebrows definitely showed this. The order prepper goes, “Your order is almost ready. I’m going to grab your fried chicken sandwich out of the fridge.” I should have asked in advance but this IS a Grab-N-Go Sandwich. My B. Nevertheless, the sando temp did NOT impact how good this MF’ing thing was. Jicama slaw accompanied by tabasco mayo in between a pillowy, Brioche(?) bun. GTFO (that’d be Get This F*cking Order)  Parmesan. Truffle. Fries. Oh, parmesan truffle fries get me every time. Pizza P.’s doesn’t hold back and will probably be a staple side order next time, every time. FWIW, they seemingly layered the parmesan in the bag and not just dumped on top like various other establishments.  Finally, we have the desserts I knew I needed to try. Their limited Tiramisu and their Pop Tarts. Cookies next time based solely on how good their pop tarts were, not the Tiramisu.  As a firm believer that local Pop Tarts have been on the gradual decline, PP’s renewed my hope that not all is lost. My strawberry filled order came complete with a smooth, yet playfully flakey pastry outer. The first bite made me instantly regret not ordering more. Also, they have other, rotating flavors I’ll be returning for so take note!  For the Tiramisu for 2, I came across this add-on thanks to their daily updated IG Stories (@pizzapolicydc). Since it was my brother and myself, it felt appropriate. This was light and direct. There were no strong or bold flavors. Nothing overpowering nor overwhelming and would be better accompanied with a glass of milk, not a wine or coffee. The VERY reasonable price reflected this and was a welcomed order, I just wouldn’t recommend it is all.  So yea, 5 for Pizza Policy. I’ll definitely be back to work through their pizzas, the occasional special and naturally, Pop Tarts. Now I think about it, it is about time for lunch…
The horchata has real milk in it, so watch out if you're lactose intolerant!
Fire 🔥 breakfast burrito 🌯 at a good price for a famished morning or as a hangover aid. Great service too!

Great food with a city vibe.  We've visited a few times, enjoying the outside seating on a nice day the first time while taking food to go the other times.  Reasonable prices and great portion sizes I love the breakfast sandwiches and all the boardwalk fries (they have multiple flavors).  The salads are also a great value and includes a healthy portion of the salad toppings (for instance the Greek salad had plenty of the olives, cucumbers, peppers, tomatoes and feta on the romaine bed).  Of course the pizza is also amazing but I love how much they have expanded the menu!
Delicious breakfast burrito and bomb hash browns. We will definitely be back to try the pizza
It's too early for pizza, but the egg and cheese English muffin is good. They also have horchata so I'll be back to try that.

I can't say enough about this place. The service was great. So nice. The food was delicious. Had cheese pizza and it was so fresh and tasty and the mac and cheese which was fantastic. Even the iced tea was delicious.

This place used to be a catering but turned into a take out stand due to covid. There is a a cute outdoor seating area. They offer pizzas, wings, breakfast options, desserts and drinks. The pizza is great, and the owners are so delightful and kind! Highly recommend this place for a quick meal while in  DC.
Great prices and everything is delicious!
Delicious pizza, lots of options, and really cute atmosphere! A fun addition to 14th street.

Very affordable, friendly staff, wonderful neighborhood addition.  And the food slaps. Awesome stuff all around.  Logan circle has been missing a breakfast burrito and upper quality pizza spot for a long time.  Come support them!
One of the best breakfast burritos in DC! Friendly staff and great food. Pop tarts are also amazing.

Great quality breakfast burrito, and a great size for the price (especially in D.C.!). A surprising kick from the sausage and the hatch chile sauce. Good quantity balance of the different elements in the burrito itself (not too much potato, too little egg, etc.) The fig poptart was sweeter than I thought it would be, but was really good. The coffee was mediocre, but is $2, so not really worth complaining about.
The Pardon pizza was excellent! Ingredients very fresh and not lacking in cheese. Crust was good. Service as usual was awesome, friendly faces and go extra to make sure your experience is great!

Best breakfast burrito and pizza in the neighborhood!! Also the Philly cheesesteak is so good! And the team are incredibly welcoming and warm! The to-go window and outdoor seating are very chill with vibrant colors. The whole experience will brighten up your day!

So far, I’ve had three different pizza versions, chicken parm sub, steak and cheese sub, a steak breakfast burrito (available all day), lobster mac-n-cheese ... all were absolutely delicious (probably why I keep running my fat a$$ back for more). Also recession-friendly prices and people-friendly owners.
10/10 breakfast burritos served in the AM. Hands down the best you can find in this part of DC.  Will definitely be back to try the pizza sometime soon !
Fantastic!!!!  I got the Whip, very very good and the crust is perfect.  The pizza was larger than I had expected, great value for the area.

We loved our pizzas and breakfast burritos we got here! This place is a really amazing addition to Logan. The people working there are SO nice and welcoming.  My only wish is that the Whip pizza had one additional element like a balsamic glaze or fig jam. Still delicious regardless!

Created my own with prosciutto and ricotta for Monday Night Football....already ordering again for football Sunday. Great quality/price point and ingredients taste fresh...nice departure from cookie cutter pizza chains. Coppis was my long time spot until it recently closed and this style of pizza is very similar. Highly recommend.
Great new find in Logan Circle! We ordered the Whip and Proxy pizzas and were extremely impressed—awesome toppings, super cheesy, and reasonably priced. Will definitely be going back!
